Header: Southern California shaken by 6.4 magnitude earthquake
Content: Southern California has been struck by its strongest earthquake in two decades, causing damage and fires. The epicentre of the 6.4 magnitude tremor was near the city of Ridgecrest, which is about 240 km north-east of Los Angeles. Firefighters provided medical assistance and dealt with fires in and around the city. People from the Mojave Desert to the Pacific coast reported feeling the quake. There was significant damage in Ridgecrest, which lies south-west of the epicentre. It was fortunate they had quake happened far away from major population centres.
